text: This is a list of women writers who were born in Tunisia or whose writings are closely associated with that country. ==A== *Ines Abassi (born 1982), poet, journalist *Faouzia Aloui (born 1958), poet, novelist *Hind Azouz (1926–2015), short story writer, essayist ==B== *Hélé Béji (born 1948), novelist, essayist *Souhayr Belhassen (born 1943), journalist, women's rights activist *Sihem Bensedrine (born 1950), journalist, human rights activist *Messaouda Boubaker (born 1954), novelist, short story writer ==E== *Fadela Echebbi (born 1946), poet *Sophie el Goulli (born 1932), poet, novelist, historian ==H== *Gisèle Halimi (born 1927), feminist writer, lawyer ==K== *Sabiha Khemir (born 1959), novelist, non-fiction writer, illustrator, artist ==M== *Boutheina Jabnoun Marai, contemporary journalist, magazine publisher *Samar Samir Mezghanni (born 1988), Arabic-language children's writer *Emna Mizouni (fl. since 2013), journalist, communications expert, Wikimedian of the Year 2019 ==P== *Perpetua (died 203), writer of a prison diary from Carthage, The Passion of Perpetua and Felicity ==R== *Naziha Réjiba, journalist, founded the online journal Kalima in 2000 ==S== *Amina Said (born 1953), French-language poet, short story writer, essayist ==T== *Najiya Thamir (1926–1988), essayist, short story writer, playwright, novelist, women's rights activist ==See also== *List of women writers *List of Tunisian writers ==References== \- Tunisian Writers Writers, women
title: List of Tunisian women writers
